intro: Chamaemelum elongatum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in composite inflorescences, which are typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs. Chamaemelum elongatum is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
